page.title: 01Fishing
page.content: In 1881 there were 18 Fishermen in Corton now there are just 5.Billy Rushmere,Geff Woolston,Garry Brown, Roy and Mr.High are all fishermen.Most Fishermen go for Shrimps and Herring. The distance that Garry Brown goes out is 2 miles. They use a tractor to take their boats down to the beach.In the Summer they catch Shrimps.They measure them in 1 pint glasses, each 40p. They are caught in a net boiled and laid on marble. In the Winter they catch Cod, Whiting, Plaice and Herring. They catch them with a long line with lots of hooks on.Each 25 hooks has an anchor. There are 500 hooks and 20 anchors. All the fishermen are part-time. Everything they catch is sold in Corton.
